ratings.comment: I had her for an evolutionary biology class, and even though the lecture was huge I attended every one.  She gives incredibly well-organized presentations that are easy to follow when you're taking notes, and all of her presentations are peppered with great examples that make it really engaging.  It was the most interesting but easy science class!

By far the best professor and class I've had here yet. Dana made the class engaging every day, I was never bored in lecture. She is great at answering questions and seems like she genuinely cares about her students. There's a bit of reading every week but it is definitely worth it.

I really enjoyed her class on Evolution and Extinction. She has very sweet mannerisms and a quirky sense of humor. There is lots of reading but she covers the material very thoroughly in class really loves what she teaches.

3 words: TAKE THIS CLASS It is by far my favorite class. Dana likes to use cool examples to teach about evolution and you learn a ton of really awesome stuff. I actually looked forward to going to this class every day and even the readings were alright.

Cannot say enough about Dana and this class. My favorite class at this university. Interesting, engaging, and all around splendid. Take this class!! You won't regret it. Readings are from interesting short books, not a giant boring textbook. That said, they are necessary.
Dana is the dopest professor at this prestigious university.  She makes this class so interesting and is always very energetic about the topics!  Definitely recommend any class taught by her!
I love Dana!! She makes this seemingly uninteresting class extremely interesting and full of quirky yet insightful comments. Taking another class with her next semester, and I simply cannot wait!

I absolutely love Dana Geary. She is such a cute old lady yet completely up to speed as well. The class is really interesting and she makes a point to make sure everyone understands. Favorite class this semester.
Awesome professor. Has an amazing personality, loves what she does, and makes the class engaging. If you go to lecture and do the homework, you're going to do well.
Best professor! Very nice and helpful.

Awesome class! Personally, this course is VERY easy. 2 midterms and a final exam, along with weekly online quizzes (which are easy points) Extra credit opportunities also. Exam questions are sometimes tricky, but if you do the readings and take notes in class they are very easy. Definitely take this class!
Exams are kind of hard, questions come from random facts on lectures and readings.  TA was awful.

Professor Geary is a lovely lady. She is very clear and passionate in lecture, and has a hilarious sense of humor. Exams tend to focus on readings and random facts from lecture, but besides that it's a very interesting class.
Nice professor. Content was kind of boring. Her tests can get really specific, especially with regard to the readings.

Nothing about the lecture or readings is difficult nor thought provoking. The content of this course is extremely simple and easy to comprehend. The exams and quizzes however are an exercise in arbitrary fact matching. We had to distinguish hypothetically correct examples from real examples and memorize/match the names of authors and species.

She is a very funny lady. She makes the lecture simple, straight forward, and adds in her share of humor. Attendance is mandatory as she does iClicker questions. Her exams are the tricky part of the course; there were some tedious details on the exams that I didn't expect. Read the books. Discussion section was somewhat helpful.

Dana is the nicest old lady and clearly so passionate about what she teaches. However, her exams are next to impossible - she LOVES the "all of the above" vs "none of the above" trick that fools everyone. They're made of minute details from lecture that you'd never expect to be tested on. I would like her class a lot more if it wasn't so much work.

Dr. Geary is honestly THE cutest old scientist lady I've ever met. Her humor is so quirky and funny. However, her exams are TOUGH. You literally need to memorize main concepts AND tiny, little facts associated with the main concepts. Alot of her exam questions are also tricky. I would love this class so much more if the exams were more fair.

Real tough. Brutal exams. I'm an A student with no science experience and it was tough. Random facts on exams, the typed notes for the cumulative final were over 65 pages. Doesn't matter, cause the test will be on things not in these notes. Interesting and clear, but the difficulty of this class is a real turn-off. Would be awesome if easier.

Fairly boring class, but interesting subject material. Lectures are pointless, but you need to take notes, because exams are made up of minuscule facts. If you are religious, prepare to be insulted for the first three solid days, and once a day the rest of the semester.

easy class.  uses clickers in lecture and quizes in discussion so you must attend all classes and read the books.  if you do so you will get an A.  she makes the class moderately interesting, and i think she does a great job considering the course material.

Seriously easy class. Took this for science credits and didn't take much effort at all. Powerpoints are all online, but get points for going to lecture. Geary was very funny and interesting, definitely recommend this class to fulfill any science requirements!

A very, very good lecturer.  Tells lots of interesting stories and has very pretty powerpoints. Her environmental sermons are boring and drag down the class, but they're worth sitting through to get to the good stuff.

I am most certainly not a "science person" but this ended up being my favorite class of the semester. Prof Geary is seriously hilarious and the majority of the material was interesting. The exams aren't completely terrible, though the final bordered on it. Take this class, you'll learn a lot.

She's a fantastic professor, and her lectures are fascinating. Her tests, however, are tricky for multiple choice. Almost every question has all of the above, and none of the above as options, and both often seem plausible. The discussions are pointless and a waste of time, but mandatory. Otherwise, a really great class.

This was my favorite class. Dana is an excellent teacher, and the class never failed to keep my interest. Tests are fair, and they are curved nicely. Just be sure to do all of the readings and take good notes and you should be fine!

By the end of the class I had a crush on this woman.  I came in with no interest in Geology at all, and came out wanting to be an archeologist.  I would highly recommend this class for anyone who needs science credits or wants to have a great proffesor.  She makes everything interesting.

I had GEO 110 with Prof. Geary and thoroughly enjoyed the class. She was a very good lecturer and the powerpoints are very helpful.  If you can, get MaryRuth as your TA....she is sooooo much better than the other TA.  MaryRuth is awesome

This was an OK class. She is a nice lady but the class is difficult for a 100 level class. Both lecture and discussion are mandatory! The reading is boring and the discussions are USELESS! There were two TA's and one was much nicer and easier than the other.. not fair. If you're not super interested in the subject you may be waisting your time.
Very helpful powerpoints

Yes, take her.. Class is fairly easy if you are willing to put in an ounce of effort.  Exams can be ruthless but curved nicely.  Attendance is mandatory via clickers.  Try to get MaryRuth as your TA, you will get  a higher grade than you would with another TA.  Overall, very well worth it and the material is extremely interesting!

I totally agree with the last post. The information we learned was SO interesting, but the tests and bi-weekly were impossible. I love Prof. Geary but don't take this class unless you feel like working pretty hard.

I hated every second of this class.  The subject matter is interesting enough but only if your not being tested on it.  Tests were horrible.  A lot of the questions were beyond arbitrary.  Dana herself is a fairly good lecturer and very friendly.  My TA was also very nice and helpful, but the tests/weekly quizes made the whole thing a bad experianc

She's a good professor, she really knows her stuff and tries to keep lectures interesting.  You have to be at class, she takes attendance with the clicker things.  All in all a relatively easy class for someone just looking for a biological science credit.

Professor Geary is extremely cool and knows how to connect with her students. Her lecture slides are always well done and keep you entertained with jokes every now and then. She offered extra credit and the exams were multiple choice. She covers a lot of material in lecture so DO NOT SKIP. Course itself had very cool material. A

This was the best class I've had so far, and Dana Geary is the best professor I've ever had. If you want help from her, she's willing to give it. And I disagree, the tests were pretty easy as long as you continuously reread your notes. She gives you some answers in class, too. I learned so much and will always remember this class!
A great professor who knows her stuff.  She's super friendly and pretty darn funny.  The class is very very interesting.  It was the most I've ever learned about biology.  Fairly easy too.

I have mixed feelings about this class. This prof is an awesome lecturer. Extremely well-organized, really interesting, & easy to follow. But her exams require complete memorization of really random information. If you are horrible with science, maybe think twice before taking this class. But, overall, a good class.
She is so nice and awesome. This is one of the most interesting classes I've taken. She gives you some questions before the exam. As long as you study, this class is a breeze and a blast.
Awesome course, awesome professor. Only class I've taken where I'd actually prefer an extra lecture to a discussion.

LOVED this class.  I have a BC because I'm not a science person and am not putting in extra time, but she is an AMAZING professor, who's extremely well-organized, witty, and HELPFUL!  Definitely take her course 2nd semester if you get the chance.  (Offers opportunities for extra credit!)  The lecture material and readings are VERY interesting!

loved this course! definately have to fight off sleep tho, b/c it's a comfy lecture hall, and her voice is so soothing.  class is relatively easy though, very interesting, and course reader is actually really good- i even gave it to my nerdy little bro for christmas.  ended up with such a crush on prof geary, she's a cool old hippie, for sure!
No Comments

she is very liberal, if that's a problem. she is very witty and tries to stay connected with the studebts by being funny, but i find myself falling asleep because there is not interaction, just looking at slides. exams are all multi-choice, but got to go to lecture because no book source to study fr
aweome teacher, uses lots of humor and examples!
No Comments
Course material is interesting, but you need to memorize lots of minute facts for the tests.  Average grade is a C on tests.  Professor is very nice and open to students concerns.
